Right it worked! For other fedora 27 users in the same situation here's a summary of the steps taken:

  • Add the negativo17 nvidia repo
  • Install nvidia drivers, cuda, cdnn, cuda-gcc and cuda-gcc-c++
  • Patch cuda/include/host_defines.h and append #define _BITS_FLOATN_H
  • Run the configure script, point to cuda and cuda-gcc
  • Go into tensorflow/core/kernel/BUILD and remove gpu_srcs for list_kernels library
  • Build

There are naturally some restarts required for driver installs to take effect, but I think that's all the steps.

body:
Right it worked! For other fedora 27 users in the same situation here's a summary of the steps taken:

* Add the [negativo17 nvidia repo ](https://negativo17.org/cuda-9-0-cudnn-7-0-and-wayland-support-in-fedora-27/) 
* Install nvidia drivers, cuda, cdnn, cuda-gcc and cuda-gcc-c++
* Patch cuda/include/host_defines.h and append `#define _BITS_FLOATN_H`
* Run the configure script, point to cuda and cuda-gcc
* Go into tensorflow/core/kernel/BUILD and remove gpu_srcs for `list_kernels` library
* Build

There are naturally some restarts required for driver installs to take effect, but I think that's all the steps.
